heading: 1.1 ggplot
text: Aim use ggplot R package creating plots. ggplot powerful visualization package enable us create kind plots want present. use ggplot, can write code can re-used . also makes easy write custom themes color palettes can re-used, produce consistency within projects people likely appreciate.

heading: 1.2 Labeling
text: Use readable concise labels. Examples good labels :“Amount donated”“GWWC” (can assume people know GWWC )Examples bad labels :amt_don

heading: 2.2 Availability of different point styles
text: Multiple different styles point available using ‘shape =’ command, followed number desired shape. Note different shapes /allow color fill, also ggplot ggplotly display shapes slightly differently.
code:
point_styles <- tibble(
  point_style = seq(0, 25),
  x = c(rep(seq(0, 9), 2), seq(0, 5)),
  y = c(rep(0, 10), rep(1, 10), rep(2, 6)),
  label = c(rep("0-9", 10), rep("10-19", 10), rep("20-25", 6))
)

point_styles <- mutate(point_styles, 
  label = fct_relevel(label, "0-9" , "10-19", "20-25")
)
p <- ggplot(point_styles, aes(x = x, y = label)) +
  scale_x_continuous(
    limits = c(0 , 9), 
    breaks = seq(from = 0, to = 9, by = 1)
  ) +
  geom_point(
    size = 5, 
    shape = point_styles$point_style, 
    color = "Black", 
    fill = "#7ccbbc"
  ) +
  theme_rethink()

ggplotly(p)

heading: 3.1 Simple bar plot
code:
p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(x = class, color = class, fill = class)) +
  geom_bar(alpha = .75) +
  scale_color_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "mako", end = .95) +
  scale_fill_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "mako", end = .95) +
  theme_rethink()

ggplotly(p, tooltip = "x")

heading: 4.1 Simple line plot
code:
ggplot(economics, aes(x = date, y = unemploy)) + 
  geom_line() +
  theme_rethink()
ggplotly(p)

heading: 4.2 Multiple lines plot
code:
p <- ggplot(economics_long, aes(x = date, y = value01, 
    color = variable)) +
  geom_line() +
  scale_color_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "mako", end = .95) +
  theme_rethink()

ggplotly(p)

heading: 5.1 Simple scatter plot
code:
p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) +
  geom_point(alpha = .85) +
  theme_rethink()

ggplotly(p)

heading: 5.2 Multiple scatter plot
code:
p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = factor(cyl))) +
  geom_point(alpha = .85) +
  scale_color_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "mako", end = .95) +
  theme_rethink()

ggplotly(p)
